Name: Vase with Names of Tutankhamun and Ankhesenamun
Description: The upper part of this splendid alabaster vase is decorated with cornices and plants. It is set on a pedestal in a form of a stool. The body of the vase is adorned with three cartouches bearing the name of King Tutankhamun and that of his consort, Queen Ankhesenamun. The left side bears the figure of a uraeus, or royal cobra, wearing the Red Crown and holding the Was and Shen scepters.
